::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module10_mcq_q93')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">A firm pays a $2 dividend, τd = 35%, and τg = 20%. What is the effective dividend tax rate τ*d?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module10_mcq_q93" value="A"> A. 10%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module10_mcq_q93" value="B"> B. 12%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module10_mcq_q93" value="C"> C. 15%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module10_mcq_q93" value="D"> D. 18.75%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module10_mcq_q93" value="E"> E. 20%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module10_mcq_q93" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ D is correct. $τ^*_d = (τ_d − τ_g)/(1 − τ_g) = (0.35 − 0.20)/(0.80) = 0.1875 = 18.75\%.$
</div>

:::
